intro: Aquilegia vulgaris monstr. corniculata, commonly known as the spurred carnation or garden columbine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, purple, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with three to five leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
